channel.title: miljko tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from miljko.

item.description: @barttels2 That is not a controversial opinion. Making medical interventions (some of which even work!) obsolete is the entire point of research.
Norm Macdonald's last show: https://t.co/DyGFb7XCDr
üìö Bullshit Jobs ended up being copy pasta of David Graeber‚Äôs fan mail. Too bad, as the premise is as relevant as ever. https://t.co/3iMfc25N3O
@barttels2 We‚Äôll, if the lily pad is big enough‚Ä¶ (NB: not my photo and I don‚Äôt know the source) https://t.co/xfoaJRbG4C

@barttels2 Exactly! And we saw it two minutes after one of the kiddos wondered aloud whether there were any turtles small enough to float on a pad (after seeing a bunch hanging around on branches). A delightful moment.
üì∑ Seriously? https://t.co/xvYOKWLmVQ
üì∑ It‚Äôs moments like this when I regret not having a newer phone (shot on an iPhone XS Max, 4 years old and still going strong). https://t.co/8jVyww7Z5S
üì∑ This is, without a doubt, the best time to visit Kenilworth aquatic gardens in DC. https://t.co/BjqEywNPF9

A wonderful thread that reads more and more like a parody the further along you go. Alas, it is all true. Kudos to Dr. Jain and others who plod through. https://t.co/50QBIahFGU
Meanwhile, in the UK‚Ä¶ https://t.co/IOeZQO2dQn

üéô Still, 2022 is the best year to be alive, and 2023 will be better. Many reasons, but JWST should be a big one for everyone. This episode of the Joy of Why podcast nicely explains why. https://t.co/3PUa2FIxYd
@dianeheids @adamcifu @CDCgov It's abuse. Imagine a government-funded infomercial suggesting to "Talk to your lawyer if‚Ä¶"
@NahanniFinanci1 Agreed. There should be more litigation, for one.

This *is* a mental health issue, but not (only) of those who shoot. https://t.co/9eP2w6LGpl
While I appreciate everything my kids‚Äô schools are doing here, I also have to note how bizarre it is to get emails like this. I‚Äôll take teacher strikes and school dismissal for lack of heating/electricity (my own elementary school experience) any day. https://t.co/c3Pqr2F9q4

‚ÄúTo be able to suppress your dislike or lack of interest in things and just do them to gain an extrinsic rewards like money or grades is a superpower when it comes to being professionally successful, but I‚Ä¶ can‚Äôt?‚Äù Med school selects for those who can! https://t.co/c3n9M3bITl
@adamcifu @CDCgov ‚ÄúTalk to your health care provider if‚Ä¶‚Äù So nice of the CDC to put other people‚Äôs skin in their own poorly thought-out game.
Funny that the phrase ‚Äústylized facts‚Äù started out in economics and is being used in social sciences when 100% of clinical medicine is, in fact, based on stylized facts. https://t.co/20zQULtssV
@MihailoCvijetic Hvala!
@Peperom36001888 He's not too far off the median there
üìö Cal Newport has some good ideas. https://t.co/YtFDKTA2eM
That‚Äôs one good-looking pig. https://t.co/XDKxLvZF2m

@GomezDLeonMD @VPrasadMDMPH Yes to both. Richard Feynman said it best. (the benefits of less paperwork and knowing you‚Äôre indirectly helping exponentially more patients aside) https://t.co/uJTJzEuuvR

@VPrasadMDMPH Interesting that you omitted teaching from this. If the exodus is real (and the jury is still out, I have my doubts) a big effect will be on future generations.

Since then: BTC -37% SP500 -5% Gold -2% ‚Ä¶and food (including olives) +9% The greatest trick the devil ever pulled was to convince the world that obvious things aren't obvious. https://t.co/RkOm5KKYRb
